questions.title: BFS traversal
DFS traversal
Detect cycle in undirected graph using DFS
Detect cycle in directed graph using DFS
Topological sorting
Number of islands
Flood fill algorithm
questions.answer:
def floodFill(image, sr, sc, color):
    orig = image[sr][sc]
    if orig == color: return image
    n, m = len(image), len(image[0])
    def dfs(i, j):
        if i<0 or i>=n or j<0 or j>=m or image[i][j]!=orig: return
        image[i][j] = color
        for di, dj in [(-1,0),(1,0),(0,-1),(0,1)]:
            dfs(i+di, j+dj)
    dfs(sr, sc)
    return image

questions.title: All paths from source to target
Find eventual safe states
questions.answer:
def eventualSafeNodes(graph):
    n = len(graph)
    color = [0]*n
    def dfs(node):
        if color[node]: return color[node] == 2
        color[node] = 1
        for nei in graph[node]:
            if not dfs(nei): return False
        color[node] = 2
        return True
    return [i for i in range(n) if dfs(i)]

questions.title: Is graph tree?
questions.description:
Given an undirected graph, check if it is a tree (connected and acyclic).

|------------|-------|----------------|-------|

questions.title: Count all paths between two vertices
Course Schedule
questions.description:
Given the total number of courses and a list of prerequisite pairs, determine if it is possible to finish all courses (i.e., the graph is a DAG).

| Test Cases | Input | Expected Output | Notes |
|------------|-------|----------------|-------|
| 1 | numCourses=2, prerequisites=[[1,0]] | True | Simple chain |
| 2 | numCourses=2, prerequisites=[[1,0],[0,1]] | False | Simple cycle |
| 3 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[3,2]] | True | Linear chain |
| 4 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,0]] | False | Cycle |
| 5 | numCourses=1, prerequisites=[] | True | Single course |
| 6 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[] | True | No prerequisites |
| 7 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,0]] | True | Tree |
| 8 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[0,2]] | False | Cycle |
| 9 | numCourses=5, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[3,2],[4,3]] | True | Long chain |
| 10 | numCourses=5, prerequisites=[[1,0],[0,2],[2,1]] | False | Cycle |
| 11 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,0],[3,1],[3,2]] | True | DAG |
| 12 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[0,2]] | False | Cycle |
| 13 | numCourses=2, prerequisites=[] | True | No prerequisites |
| 14 | numCourses=2, prerequisites=[[0,1]] | True | Simple chain |
| 15 | numCourses=2, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,0]] | False | Simple cycle |
| 16 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2]] | True | Chain |
| 17 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,0]] | False | Cycle |
| 18 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,3]] | True | Chain |
| 19 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,3],[3,0]] | False | Cycle |
| 20 | numCourses=5, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,3],[3,4]] | True | Chain |
| 21 | numCourses=5, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,3],[3,4],[4,0]] | False | Cycle |
| 22 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,0],[2,1]] | True | DAG |
| 23 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[0,2]] | False | Cycle |
| 24 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[3,2],[1,3]] | False | Cycle |
| 25 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[3,2]] | True | Chain |
| 26 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[3,2],[0,3]] | False | Cycle |
| 27 | numCourses=6, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[3,2],[4,3],[5,4]] | True | Long chain |
| 28 | numCourses=6, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[3,2],[4,3],[5,4],[0,5]] | False | Cycle |
| 29 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2]] | True | Chain |
| 30 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,0]] | False | Cycle |
| 31 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,3]] | True | Chain |
| 32 | numCourses=4, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,3],[3,0]] | False | Cycle |
| 33 | numCourses=5, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,3],[3,4]] | True | Chain |
| 34 | numCourses=5, prerequisites=[[0,1],[1,2],[2,3],[3,4],[4,0]] | False | Cycle |
| 35 | numCourses=2, prerequisites=[[1,0]] | True | Simple chain |
| 36 | numCourses=2, prerequisites=[[1,0],[0,1]] | False | Simple cycle |
| 37 | numCourses=1, prerequisites=[] | True | Single course |
| 38 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,0]] | True | Tree |
| 39 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[[1,0],[2,1],[0,2]] | False | Cycle |
| 40 | numCourses=3, prerequisites=[] | True | No prerequisites |
questions.answer:
def canFinish(numCourses, prerequisites):
    from collections import defaultdict, deque
    graph = defaultdict(list)
    indegree = [0]*numCourses
    for a, b in prerequisites:
        graph[b].append(a)
        indegree[a] += 1
    queue = deque([i for i in range(numCourses) if indegree[i]==0])
    count = 0
    while queue:
        node = queue.popleft()
        count += 1
        for nei in graph[node]:
            indegree[nei] -= 1
            if indegree[nei] == 0:
                queue.append(nei)
    return count == numCourses
